com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender

Class SendVoice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendData
      • com.willblaschko.android.alexa.sender.SendVoice

  • public class SendVoice
extends SendData
    A subclass of SendData that sends a recorded raw audio to the AVS server, unlike SendText, this does not use an intermediary steps, but the starting/stopping need to be handled manually or programmatically, which Google's voice offering already does automatically (listens for speech thresholds). This is the class that should be used, ideally, instead of SendText, but it offers a little less flexibility as a standalone. Using the byte[] buffer in startRecording(), it's possible to prepend any audio recorded with pre-recorded or generated audio, in order to simplify or complicate the command.

    • Method Detail

      • startRecording

        public void startRecording(Context context,
                           java.lang.String url,
                           java.lang.String accessToken,
                           @Nullable
                           byte[] buffer,
                           @Nullable
                           AsyncCallback<java.lang.Void,java.lang.Exception> callback)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        The trigger to open a new AudioRecord and start recording with the intention of sending the audio to the AVS server using the stopRecord(). This will have permissions issues in Marshmallow that need to be handled at the Activity level (checking for permission to record audio, and requesting it if we don't already have permissions).
        Parameters:
        context - local/application context
        url - our POST url
        accessToken - our user's access token
        buffer - a byte[] that allows us to prepend whatever audio is recorded by the user with either generated ore pre-recorded audio, this needs to be in the same format as the audio being recorded
        callback - our callback to notify us when we change states
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • stopRecording

        public AvsResponse stopRecording()
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 AvsException
        Stop recording the user's audio and send the request to the AVS server, parse the response
        Returns:
        the parsed response from the AVS server based on the recorded audio
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        AvsException
